title: BUG:  multi-dimensional features. ambiguous Boolean definition of array ValueError: The truth value of an array with more than one element is ambiguous. Use a.any() or a.all()

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behaviour

body:
### Issue Description

I have dataset with embeddings/vector features, when I run the kernal explainer shap values methods with these features I run into the issue of `ValueError: The truth value of an array with more than one element is ambiguous. Use a.any() or a.all()` the stack trace of the issue as shown below

```python
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
Cell In[4], line 5
      3 data = pd.DataFrame({"feature": [1.0, 2.0], "embedding_feature": [np.array([3.0, 4.0]), np.array([5.0, 6.0])]})
      4 explainer = shap.KernelExplainer(kernel_fn, data)
----> 5 shap_values = explainer.shap_values(data, nsamples=2)

File ~/anaconda3/envs/myenv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/shap/explainers/_kernel.py:190, in Kernel.shap_values(self, X, **kwargs)
    188 if self.keep_index:
    189     data = convert_to_instance_with_index(data, column_name, index_value[i:i + 1], index_name)
--> 190 explanations.append(self.explain(data, **kwargs))
    191 if kwargs.get("gc_collect", False):
    192     gc.collect()

File ~/anaconda3/envs/myenv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/shap/explainers/_kernel.py:217, in Kernel.explain(self, incoming_instance, **kwargs)
    213 match_instance_to_data(instance, self.data)
    215 # find the feature groups we will test. If a feature does not change from its
    216 # current value then we know it doesn't impact the model
--> 217 self.varyingInds = self.varying_groups(instance.x)
    218 if self.data.groups is None:
    219     self.varyingFeatureGroups = np.array([i for i in self.varyingInds])

File ~/anaconda3/envs/myenv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/shap/explainers/_kernel.py:417, in Kernel.varying_groups(self, x)
    415             continue
    416         x_group = x_group.todense()
--> 417     num_mismatches = np.sum(np.frompyfunc(self.not_equal, 2, 1)(x_group, self.data.data[:, inds]))
    418     varying[i] = num_mismatches > 0
    419 varying_indices = np.nonzero(varying)[0]

File ~/anaconda3/envs/myenv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/shap/explainers/_kernel.py:404, in Kernel.not_equal(i, j)
    402     return 0 if np.isclose(i, j, equal_nan=True) else 1
    403 else:
--> 404     return 0 if i == j else 1

ValueError: The truth value of an array with more than one element is ambiguous. Use a.any() or a.all()
```

### Minimal Reproducible Example

```python
import shap
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

def kernel_fn(inp):
    return np.array([1.0])
data = pd.DataFrame({"feature": [1.0, 2.0], "embedding_feature": [np.array([3.0, 4.0]), np.array([5.0, 6.0])]})
explainer = shap.KernelExplainer(kernel_fn, data)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(data, nsamples=2)
```


### Expected Behavior

Replacing the line  `return 0 if i == j else 1` [here](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/b9f29ccff43dc704428608645065ad740d84d653/shap/explainers/_kernel.py#L458) 
with `np.all(return 0 if i == j else 1)`  seems to solve the problem.
Would be grateful for any feedback on this.

### Bug report checklist

- [X] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported.
- [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest release](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/releases) of shap.
- [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [master branch](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#installing-from-the-master-branch) of shap.
- [X] I'd be interested in making a PR to fix this bug

### Installed Versions

`0.42.1`
